summary_promot:
You are given an image and related metadata and context.

            Metadata:
            - Document Title: Commander Beetle
            - Section Title: Commander Beetle Boss Fight and Guide

            Context:
            - Preceding Text: "# Commander Beetle

The Commander Beetle is an optional Yaoguai Chief boss fight that you can find during Chapter 4 of Black Myth Wukong. Located between the Forest of Ferocity and the Temple Entrance itself, this boss trains a group of Daoists who will all try to stop you.

* Rewards: Commander Beetle Spirit, Knot of Voidness, Refined Iron Sand, 1562 Experience, 1434 Will


The Commander Beetle is an optional boss -- though hard to miss as you explore the Temple of Yellow Flowers. From the Forest of Ferocity Shrine, you need only make your way along the main path and up the stairs to find a large courtyard where the boss trains a group of several Sword Daoists.

## Commander Beetle Boss Fight and Guide

The Commander Beetle would be a fairly straightforward miniboss fight, if not for the six Sword Daoists he's currently training in the large courtyard where you'll find him just past the Forest of Ferocity. Unfortunately, these enemies will respawn until you defeat the Commander, so you won't be able to get him alone so easily."
            - Following Text: "Knowing that the Daoists don't have a whole lot of heath, there are two things you have on your side: large area-of-effect Spirit Attacks, and your Pluck of Many Spell. The Pluck of Many is a great bet for disorienting the group as you attack, though results can vary, and you'll likely have to jump in an finish off a few Daoists yourself. One is even likely to drop the **Fruit of Dao Soak** for your Gourd!

This can get tricky, as the Commander Beetle won't just wait around patiently while you defeat his students. He can employ huge strikes that cleave the very ground in a line where he strikes, and if you aren't paying attention, you can usually get hit by the tremors before you know what's going on.

Try to keep in view as much as possible while defeating the Daoists so you can prepare to dodge away from his moves."

            Your task:
            1. Generate a **short, clear, and informative English summary** of the image.
            2. Focus primarily on the **preceding and following text** to infer the image's **purpose, content, or narrative role**.
            3. Incorporate any relevant metadata (e.g., section or document titles) to improve coherence, **but do not assume any domain-specific knowledge** unless explicitly stated.
            4. Do **not** speculate beyond the visible content.



            Output Format:
            Preceding Text Summary:
            Provide a concise summary of the preceding text that gives context to the image.
            Image Summary:
            Provide a summary of the image, describing its purpose and content based on the context.
            Following Text Summary:
            Provide a concise summary of the following text that elaborates on the information related to the image.
img_summary:
Preceding Text Summary:  
The preceding text introduces the Commander Beetle, an optional miniboss in *Black Myth Wukong*, encountered in Chapter 4 between the Forest of Ferocity and the Temple Entrance. The fight takes place in a courtyard where Commander Beetle trains six Sword Daoists who will continuously respawn until the boss is defeated. Rewards for defeating him include the Commander Beetle Spirit, Knot of Voidness, Refined Iron Sand, and experience points.

Image Summary:  
The image depicts an in-game battle scene from *Black Myth Wukong*, showing the player character engaged in combat with the Commander Beetle and his group of Sword Daoists. The setting is a courtyard with a stone floor and surrounding structures. The player is wielding a glowing staff, and the enemies are actively attacking. Health bars and combat effects are visible, indicating an intense fight.

Following Text Summary:  
The following text provides strategies for the fight, emphasizing the use of area-of-effect Spirit Attacks and the Pluck of Many Spell to manage the Sword Daoists. It warns that the Commander Beetle will not wait passively and can unleash powerful ground-cleaving strikes, requiring the player to stay alert and dodge while dealing with the Daoists.
